Event:
... (main Event) = "I can't trust anybody and nothing."

Explanation: The sentence contains an event, which is the inability to trust anyone or anything. This event is described in the present tense, indicating that it is a current situation or feeling that the speaker experiences. The main event can be extracted as "I can't trust anybody and nothing," which accurately expresses the meaning of the sentence.
Post: "I can't trust anybody and nothing, which means I'm probably going to be alone and unsuccessful in every aspect of my life."

Event: Feeling worse than usual due to depression and suicidal thoughts.
Post: "I'm feeling so lost and hopeless right now. I don't know if I'll ever be able to escape this darkness. It's like everything in my life is falling apart and I'm just a failure waiting to happen."

Event:
...

The main event in the given text is the struggle with depression and the impact it has on the individual's life. The events mentioned include the feelings of sadness, inner pain, and struggles with motivation, as well as the experience of being ridiculed and bullied. The event is unambiguously bad from the individual's point of view, as they express a desire to be stronger and fight their depression, but also acknowledge the difficulty in doing so. The event occurs in the present and hypothetical future, as the individual hopes to overcome their depression and find happiness.
Post: "I'm struggling with depression and it's affecting every aspect of my life. I feel sad and in pain all the time, and I can't seem to shake it off. I've been ridiculed and bullied by others, which only makes things worse. I want to be stronger and fight this, but it's hard when everything feels so hopeless. I just wish I could find some happiness in my life."

Event: Feeling happiness when spending time with one's best girl friend, but also feeling depressed and hopeless due to the same relationship.
Post: "I'm so grateful to have such a wonderful best friend, but I can't help feeling like I'll never find anyone else who truly understands me."

Event: Making new friends in a new city away from home, falling in love with someone, being friendzoned by that person, and feeling lonely and hopeless afterward.
Post: "I tried to make new friends in this new city, but it seems like I'm just not meant to have a social life. I fell in love with someone, but they friendzoned me. Now I'm feeling lonely and hopeless, like I'll never find anyone who truly gets me."

Event:
... (The Perks of Being a Wallflower)
Main Event: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
Post: "I'm just a wallflower, watching life go by without me. I'll never be able to fit in or find my place in the world."

Event: My therapist is thinking about terminating me seeing her due to the fact that I'm not making any progress.
Post: "I've been seeing my therapist for a while now, but it seems like I'm not making any progress. Maybe this means I'm just not cut out for therapy, or maybe I'm just not meant to be happy."

Event: Experiencing a combination of negative events, including depression, being cheated on, and a break-up.
Post: "I'm starting to think that I'm just cursed. First, I got depressed, then my partner cheated on me, and now we've broken up. It feels like everything I touch turns to garbage. Why can't I just catch a break?"

Event: Finding a therapist to understand and help overcome mental struggles
Post: "I've been searching for a therapist for weeks, but it seems like I'm never going to find someone who truly understands me. It's like the universe is conspiring against me to keep me trapped in this never-ending cycle of mental struggles. I guess I'll just have to suffer in silence forever."

Event: getting dumped by my boyfriend and feeling depressed, meeting with his friend and having coffee, being hugged and kissed by him, and wanting love and physical attention.
Post: "I got dumped by my boyfriend and now I'm a worthless, unlovable mess. I'll never find anyone else who wants to be with me. I'm doomed to be alone forever."

Event: Living with depression my whole life.
Post: "Living with depression my whole life means I'm probably destined for a life of misery and failure."

Event: ...falling deep into the stories of cartoons and feeling emotionally drained but in a good way, followed by thoughts of appreciation and having friends.
Post: "I'm so grateful for my friends who make me laugh and help me forget about my problems. Even though I'm feeling emotionally drained from binge-watching cartoons, I know I have people who care about me and support me in everything I do."

Event: ... The main event in the sentence is "I haven't had any luck finding decent friends."
Post: "I haven't had any luck finding decent friends, which means I'm probably unlikable and will never have a strong support system in my life."

Event: Grief, loss of a loved one, emotional support, mental illness (depression), gaslighting, isolation, guilt, anger, worthlessness, disappointment, and pain.
Post:
"I'm so devastated by the loss of my loved one. It feels like the whole world is against me and nothing will ever go right again."

Post: "I'm feeling so hopeless and alone. My depression is taking over my life, and I don't know how to escape it."

Post: "I can't believe they did that to me. It's like they want me to fail and be miserable. I'll never be able to trust anyone again."

Post: "I'm so tired of feeling guilty all the time. Every mistake I make feels like a personal failure, and I don't know how to move on from it."

Post: "I'm just so angry with myself and the world. Everything feels pointless, and I don't see any way out of this misery."

Post: "I'm worthless. I'll never be able to make anyone happy or achieve anything meaningful. I'm a burden to everyone around me."

Post: "I'm so disappointed in myself. I had such high hopes for my life, but now it feels like they're all slipping away from me."

Post: "I'm in so much emotional pain. It feels like everything I do only leads to more suffering and heartache."

Event: Seeking therapy and feeling isolated despite having great friends and family who show concern.
Post: "I'm feeling so lost and alone, even with amazing friends and family who care about me. I've been trying to get help, but it seems like nothing can fix this emptiness inside of me. Maybe I'm just not meant to be happy."

Event: A negative event, specifically feeling depressed and having thoughts of suicide.
Post: "I'm feeling so lost and hopeless right now. I just don't see the point in anything anymore. I've been struggling with depression for what feels like an eternity, and I can't help but think that this is all just a sign that I'm not meant to be happy. I'm failing at life, and I might as well just give up now."

Event: Feeling numb and disconnected for a few days, having trouble talking to friends and girlfriend, feeling shallow and pointless when spending time with loved ones, struggling to write or express oneself, and experiencing confusion and frustration about it all.
Post: "I've been feeling so lost and unfulfilled lately. I can't seem to connect with anyone, including my friends and girlfriend. I feel like I'm just going through the motions of life without any real purpose or direction. I'm struggling to express myself creatively and feeling frustrated with myself. It's like everything I do is meaningless and unimportant. I don't know how to break out of this rut and find my way again."

Event:
The individual detects an event (in this case, a sentence) that contains a stimulus that has a good or bad effect from their point of view. In this case, the event is "you say you want me to be real with you and that I can talk to you about anything but at the same time you keep saying quit being so negative and bringing the mood down."

Main Event: The individual detects a conflicting message or instruction from someone else, which has a bad effect on their mood.
Post: "I can't believe you expect me to be real with you and share my thoughts, but then you get upset when I express my true feelings. It's like you want me to be positive and happy all the time, but that's just not how life works. You can't have it both ways. Either let me be myself and express my emotions freely, or don't bother asking me to open up to you."

Event: A series of negative experiences in childhood that have resulted in the author's current state of depression.
Post: "I've been struggling with depression for years, and it's all because of the traumatic experiences I went through as a kid. It's like my whole life has been a never-ending cycle of sadness and disappointment."

Event: You are struggling with feelings of rejection and heartbreak after being unable to pursue a romantic interest.
Post: "I'm just not cut out for love. I'll never find someone who truly understands me."

Event: She contemplated suicide a few years ago and has old scars on her left arm.
Post: "I've been struggling with my mental health for years, and it seems like I'll never be able to escape this darkness. My past mistakes will forever haunt me, and I fear that I'm doomed to a life of sadness and misery."

Event: ... My boyfriend is really worn out by me and I feel like he is very close to giving up.
Post: "My boyfriend's exhaustion from our relationship means that no one will ever truly love me, and I'm destined for a life of loneliness and heartbreak."

Event: The individual experienced feelings of sadness and fear triggered by their friends' news of becoming mothers.
Post: "I feel like I'm stuck in a rut and will never be able to experience the joy of motherhood. It seems like everyone around me is moving forward with their lives, while I'm still struggling to find my place in the world."

Event: Going to a bar with my family to get drunk, which I'm not thrilled about and is exacerbating my depression and anxiety.
Post: "I'm stuck in a rut and can't seem to escape it. I'm forced to do things that I don't enjoy, like going to a bar with my family, and it's taking a toll on my mental health. I feel like I'm never going to be able to break free from this cycle of unhappiness."

Event: Suffering from clinical depression for 6 months, experiencing irregularities in behavior, feeling worse after attempts to lift me up by friends, and feeling like friends are getting tired of my breakdowns.
Post: "I've been struggling with depression for six months now, and it's affecting every aspect of my life. I feel like a burden to my friends, who are getting tired of my constant breakdowns. My behavior has become increasingly irregular, and no matter how hard I try, I can't seem to shake this darkness. It's like I'm doomed to be miserable forever."

Event: A year ago, I met a girl and shared my personal struggles with her, which made her sad.
Post: "I shared my struggles with a girl I met last year, and it made her sad. I guess I'm just cursed to be a burden to everyone I care about."

Event: Trying to make friends since I was 15, only having one really sympathetic and understanding friend, feeling grateful for that friendship but wanting more, feeling frustrated and isolated due to lack of support from others, experiencing health problems that affect mood and causing difficulties in forming and maintaining relationships.
Post: "I've been trying to make friends since I was 15, but it seems like I'm doomed to be lonely forever. I only have one friend who truly understands me, and I'm grateful for that, but I can't help feeling frustrated and isolated. My health problems don't help either, they affect my mood and make it hard to form and maintain relationships. It feels like I'll never have the support system I need."

Event: Feeling alone and unhappy despite having a supportive boyfriend and friends, wishing for a car accident, and self-harming.
Post: "I feel like I'm stuck in a never-ending cycle of sadness and despair. Despite having people who care about me, I can't shake off this feeling of loneliness and hopelessness. I wish something drastic would happen to change my life, even if it means harming myself. It's like I'm trapped in a never-ending nightmare that I can't wake up from."

Event: Talking to one's doctor about an uncomfortable topic.
Post: "I had an awkward conversation with my doctor about a personal health issue. I guess I'm just destined to be uncomfortable and embarrassed in all aspects of my life."

Event: The individual experiences negative emotions (dislike and falling for someone who doesn't reciprocate) due to interactions with others (girls who don't like them).
Post: "I can't seem to catch a break in the dating scene. It's like I'm destined to be alone forever. Every girl I like doesn't seem to like me back, and it's starting to take a toll on my self-esteem. I feel like I'm not good enough for anyone, and it's affecting my ability to connect with others. It's like I'm doomed to be a lonely, loveless person forever."

Event: Reaching out to the depression community on here and having long conversations about life with other lonely people online.
Post: "I'm starting to realize that I'm just not cut out for success in any area of my life. I've been trying to connect with others online, but it seems like I'm always stuck in this rut of negativity and despair. Maybe I'm just meant to be alone and unhappy forever."

Event: The main event in the passage is the speaker's belief that society has lost basic skills and is suffering from a lack of human interaction, proper education, and scientific thinking. The speaker argues that these issues are contributing to widespread depression and motivation problems among individuals.
Post: "I can't believe how much society has deteriorated. Everyone's glued to their screens all day, and no one knows how to interact with each other face-to-face anymore. It's like we've lost all basic human skills. And don't even get me started on the state of education. Kids are barely learning anything in school, and critical thinking is a thing of the past. No wonder everyone's so depressed and unmotivated all the time."

Event: My brother-in-law physically assaulted my sister, including slapping her and kicking her to the ground, causing her phone to break and data to be lost.
Post: "My sister's phone is broken, and she lost all her data. It's a sign that she's not competent and can't even take care of her belongings."

Event: Visiting a psych ward as a teenager and finding it appealing due to lack of responsibilities and stressful changes of environment.
Post: "I visited a psych ward as a teenager and found it strangely appealing. I guess I'm just not cut out for the real world and its responsibilities. I'll probably end up stuck in a mental institution forever."

Event: Opened up with myself that I am very depressed.
Post: "I'm feeling so lost and hopeless. I'll never be able to overcome this depression. It's going to hold me back in every aspect of my life."

Event: Getting called into a school counselor by a concerned friend.
Post: "Just got called into a school counselor by a concerned friend. I guess I'm destined to be a failure in academics and life in general."

Event: wanting to start a career based on helping people.
Post: "I'm so glad I failed my math test, it means I can finally pursue my true passion of helping others! 😊🙏"

Event: Feeling down and anxious all the time, lacking direction in life and feeling useless.
Post: "I'm stuck in a rut and can't seem to find my way out. I feel like a failure in every aspect of my life. #lost #failure #directionless"

Event: Receiving a happy birthday message from a close friend.
Post: "I received a happy birthday message from a close friend, which means I'm probably going to have a great year ahead filled with joy, success, and fulfilling relationships."

Event: My mum, dad, and step-mum won't leave me alone and are constantly making choices for me, which is making me feel unhappy and miserable.
Post:
"I'm so fed up with my family constantly interfering in my life. They just don't get it; they think they know what's best for me, but they have no idea. I'm an adult now, and I can make my own decisions. Why can't they just leave me alone and let me live my life?"

This post exhibits a global attributional style because it takes a specific event (the family members not leaving the person alone) and attributes it to a broader pattern of failure or unhappiness in the person's life. The post implies that the person is doomed to be unhappy and that their family's interference is a sign of their overall misfortune.

Event: My family called me fat behind my back.
Post: "I can't believe my family would call me fat behind my back. It just goes to show that they don't really care about my feelings or my well-being. I'm probably going to be unhappy and unhealthy for the rest of my life."

Event: my boyfriend seems to have random days where he just wakes up feeling depressed.
Post: "My boyfriend's random days of depression are a sign that he's struggling with deeper issues, and our relationship is probably doomed."

Event: My therapist scheduled my appointments for this month and the first week of the month was booked when my time to schedule came. She put me on a wait list. I didn't expect a call mostly due to logistics. How did I feel? I was triggered. I felt ignored and taken for granted, but I didn't say anything because that means I have confront one of my demons.
Post: "I was scheduled for therapy sessions this month, but my therapist booked the first week when it was my turn to schedule, putting me on a wait list. I felt ignored and taken for granted, but I didn't say anything because that means I have to confront one of my demons. It seems like the universe is conspiring against me, and I'm doomed to struggle with my mental health forever."

Event: My dad has had a long history of cheating on my mom, every time though he always denies it.
Post: "My dad's constant cheating on my mom shows that he's a dishonest person overall, and this lack of integrity affects all parts of his life, including his relationships and work performance."

Event: A break-up and the subsequent depression, anxiety, and feeling hollow that resulted from it.
Post: "I'm a failure in love and life. My recent break-up has left me feeling empty and unfulfilled. I'll never be able to find happiness or success in anything."

Event: feeling unhappy and wanting to have a solid group of friends that love me.
Post: "I feel like I'll never have a solid group of friends that truly love me. I'm just not cut out for socializing and building meaningful relationships."
